Title: ‚Ü©Ô∏èPreliminary election results in Georgia: ‚ñ™Ô∏èTurnout was 58.94%. ...

The ruling party 'Georgian Dream - Democratic Georgia' gains 52.99% of the vote, which approximately corresponds to 90-91 mandates in the parliament of 150 seats; ‚ñ™Ô∏èExecutive Secretary of the 'Georgian Dream' Mamuka Mdinaradze admitted that the party expected more from the election results; ‚ñ™Ô∏èThe ruling party will be able to single-handedly form a government, but it will not have a constitutional majority to change the basic law;‚ñ™Ô∏èBefore the elections, Georgian Dream stated that it needed a coalition majority (113 out of 150 mandates) to recognize Saakashvili‚Äôs United National party as unconstitutional movement', which participated in the elections under the name 'Unity - National Movement'; ‚ñ™Ô∏èThe opposition has a total of slightly more than 38% of the votes. According to preliminary data, the Coalition for Change receives 11.2% of the votes, Unity - National Movement - 9.83%, Strong Georgia - 9.02%, Gakharia for Georgia party - 8.22%; ‚ñ™Ô∏èGeneral Secretary of the Georgian Dream, Mayor of Tbilisi Kakha Kaladze said that opposition parties do not enjoy the support of the people, they will not be able to stage a coup or revolution in the country; ‚ñ™Ô∏èKaladze warned that the state 'will follow a very harsh reaction' if anyone... then he will dare to take illegal steps;‚ñ™Ô∏èSaakashvili‚Äôs party stated that it does not recognize the election results. The head of the party, Tinatin Bokuchava, called the elections 'stolen'; ‚ñ™Ô∏èThe opposition 'Coalition for Change' does not recognize the election results and has begun protests since October 27. This was stated by one of the party leaders, Elene Khoshtaria.
